channel.title: Bloomberg Technology
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 BLOOMBERG L.P. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

item.title: Google Facing at Least €12 Billion in Civil Claims Across Europe
item.description: The tech giant was hit with a €2.4 billion fine in the EU over its shopping search service. Suits from alleged victims could add billions more.
item.dc:creator: Karin Matussek

media:content.media:description: The Google Docks building, background center, in the 'Silicon Docks' area of Dublin.

item.title: China’s Meituan to Start Brazil Business With $1 Billion Budget
item.description: Meituan will invest $1 billion over five years to start and expand a food delivery service in Brazil, as Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva hopes to transform the country’s commodities-reliant economy with help from China.
item.dc:creator: John Liu, Claire Che

media:content.media:description: An insulated food bag for Keeta, a subsidiary of Meituan, on a motorcycle in Hong Kong, China. Photographer: Lam Yik/Bloomberg

item.title: Indian Tech Stocks May Get a Lift From US-China Trade Truce
item.description: Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:
item.dc:creator: Chiranjivi Chakraborty

item.title: Nissan Shares Jump After Report Job Cuts to Double to 20,000
item.description: Nissan Motor Co. shares rallied on Tuesday after a report that the Japanese automaker will eliminate 11,000 more jobs than previously forecast as part of a plan to restructure its flailing business.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Takahashi

media:content.media:description: A Nissan Motor Co. Ariya electric crossover sport utility vehicle (SUV), bottom, on display in a showroom at the company's global headquarters in Yokohama, Japan, on Wednesday, Nov. 9, 2022. Nissan raised its profit outlook as a weak yen boosted repatriated income, helping to compensate for a persistent shortage of chips and supply-chain constraints that have curtailed output in the industry.

item.title: Morgan Stanley Is Leading IPO for Software Maker Figma
item.description: Design software business Figma Inc. hired Morgan Stanley to lead what could be one of the year’s biggest initial public offerings, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Katie Roof

media:content.media:description: The Figma logo on a smartphone and the Adobe logo on a laptop arranged in the Brooklyn borough of New York, US, on Friday, July 28, 2023. Adobe Inc.s $20 billion takeover of design startup Figma Inc. is on course for an in-depth investigation from European Union merger regulators, adding to growing global scrutiny of the deal dubbed by Adobes boss as transformational.

item.title: JD.com’s Low Profitability in Focus as Traders Brace for Results
item.description: Investors are prepared for a big jolt in battered shares of JD.com Inc. following an earnings report from the Chinese e-commerce company, which is mounting a costly foray into food delivery.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Yang

media:content.media:description: Food delivery riders of JD Takeaway, left, and Meituan in Shenyang, China, in April 2025. Source: Visual China Group/Getty Images

item.title: Samsung Debuts $1,099 S25 Edge, Kicking Off Wave of Thin Phones
item.description: Samsung Electronics Co. on Monday rolled out a slimmed-down Galaxy S25 Edge smartphone, kicking off a wave of drastically thinner handsets expected to launch this year.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman, Yoolim Lee

media:content.media:description: The Samsung Galaxy S25 Edge is displayed at a Samsung showroom in New York, US, on Friday, May 9, 2025. Samsung Electronics Co.'s latest product, which goes on sale May 30 for $1099, is 5.8 millimeters thick and weighs 163 grams, making it about 30% thinner and 25% lighter than the S25 Ultra, the South Korea-based technology giant's highest-end smartphone.

item.title: TikTok, Meta Endure Tougher Asia Crackdown as US Efforts Stall
item.description: Some of the toughest new laws attempting to rein in TikTok, Instagram and Snapchat aren’t coming from Washington or Brussels. They’re emerging from capitals such as Canberra, Jakarta and Kuala Lumpur.
item.dc:creator: Newley Purnell

media:content.media:description: A man browses Facebook on his smartphone in Jakarta. Some 40% of Facebook’s user accounts globally are in Southeast and South Asia.

item.title: Tech Stocks Rise on US-China Trade, Trump Talks Apple | Bloomberg Technology
item.description: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde takes a look at the Nasdaq's return to a bull market following US-China trade talks. Plus, Ankur Crawford from Alger discusses how an easing of US chip curbs to China could help innovation. And Gautam Mukunda, a lecturer at the Yale School of Management, says Tesla risks becoming the next Boeing if it doesn't do more to focus on safety. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Trump Talks With Apple’s Cook as iPhone Price Hikes Loom
item.description: US President Donald Trump said he spoke with Apple Inc. Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook earlier on Monday, just as the iPhone maker was reported to be considering price increases later this year.
item.dc:creator: Amy Thomson

media:content.media:description: An employee bags a new iPhone for a customer at an Apple Store in London. Photographer: Chris Ratcliffe/Bloomberg

item.title: Traders Dumped Levered Semiconductor Funds Just Before 24% Surge
item.description: ETF investors exited bullish bets on semiconductors last week, just before the sector staged one of its sharpest one-day rebounds in months as Wall Street cheers a US-China trade truce.
item.dc:creator: Vildana Hajric

media:content.media:description: A rack of 300mm silicon wafers during the manufacturing process at the Robert Bosch GmbH semiconductor fabrication plant (FAB) in Dresden, Germany, in Dresden, Germany, on Monday, May 31, 2021. Bosch agreed to cooperate with Globalfoundries — an Abu Dhabi-owned chip manufacturer with plants in the U.S., Singapore and Germany — to develop automotive radar semiconductors that should hit the market in the second half of this year. Photographer: Krisztian Bocsi/Bloomberg

item.title: State AI Regulation Ban Tucked Into Republican Tax, Fiscal Bill
item.description: A powerful House committee has tucked language preventing states from regulating artificial intelligence into President Donald Trump’s massive tax and spending bill, a move that would benefit many of the US’s largest tech and AI companies.
item.dc:creator: Emily Birnbaum

media:content.media:description: A technician types questions into a program used to test and develop artificial intelligence programs.

item.title: Apple to Unveil New AI Tool to Increase iPhone Battery Life
item.description: Apple Inc. is planning to use artificial intelligence technology to address a frequent source of customer frustration: the iPhone’s battery life.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman

media:content.media:description: A customer uses an Apple iPhone 16 in an Apple Inc. store.

item.title: Spain Blackout Shows Need for Batteries in Renewable-Heavy World
item.description: Companies are working on technologies from batteries to AI that can help ensure renewables and more electricity demand don’t threaten the grid.
item.dc:creator: Naureen S Malik, Eamon Farhat

media:content.media:description: Pedestrians try to use their mobile phones on an unlit street during a power outage in Molins de Rei, Spain, on Monday, April 28, 2025. Spain and Portugal lost power shortly after 12:30 p.m. local time in a massive blackout that idled public transport, airports and phone services, bringing the daily activities of millions to a halt.

item.title: ABB Weighs Sale of Robotics Arm as Alternative to Spinoff
item.description: ABB Ltd. is exploring a potential sale of the robotics unit, which could be worth more than $3.5 billion, as an alternative to the main spinoff plan, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Eyk Henning, Allegra Catelli

media:content.media:description: An ABB Ltd. robot places Raspberry Pi personal computers in to final packaging boxes on the production line at the Sony UK Technology Centre in Pencoed, UK, on Friday, Feb. 2, 2024. Personal computer maker Raspberry Pi appointed bankers at Peel Hunt and Jefferies to prepare a London initial public offering, a listing that would be a win for the UK capital after an exodus of companies to the US.

item.title: AI Startup Perplexity Nears Funding at $14 Billion Value
item.description: Perplexity AI Inc., a startup building an artificial intelligence search engine to compete with Google, is in advanced discussions to raise a new round of funding at a $14 billion valuation — a jump from its most recent value but lower than it was initially targeting.
item.dc:creator: Kate Clark, Shirin Ghaffary

item.title: Bulgarians Who Spied for Russia Sentenced to Jail by UK Judge
item.description: Six Bulgarian nationals who were part of a Russian spy ring run by Wirecard’s fugitive ex-chief operating officer were sentenced to as long as 10 years in prison by a London judge.
item.dc:creator: Upmanyu Trivedi

media:content.media:description: Court artist sketches of Bulgarian nationals, from left, Katrin Ivanova, Vanya Gaberova, Orlin Roussev, Ivan Stoyanov and Bizer Dzhambazov appearing via video link at Westminster Magistrates' Court, London, charged with spying for Russia, Tuesday Sept. 26, 2023.

item.title: Pritzker Scores Quantum Win as Australian Firm Picks Chicago Hub
item.description: Illinois’s quantum campus, championed by Governor JB Pritzker, is adding an Australian tech firm to its list of future tenants on Chicago’s South Side, advancing his push to make the state a hub for the industry.
item.dc:creator: Shruti Singh

media:content.media:description: JB Pritzker

item.title: Telefonica Hires Citi for Chile Unit Sale, El Confidencial Says
item.description: Telefonica SA mandated Citigroup Inc. to manage the sale of its Chilean unit, after the Spanish-based company offloaded many of its other subsidiaries in Latin America.
item.dc:creator: Carolina Gonzalez

media:content.media:description: Citigroup Inc Photographer: Scott Eells/Bloomberg

item.title: SoftBank Stargate Venture With OpenAI Snags on Tariff Fears
item.description: SoftBank Group Corp.’s plans to invest $100 billion in artificial intelligence infrastructure in the US have slowed, with economic risks stemming from Washington’s tariffs holding up financing talks.
item.dc:creator: Min Jeong Lee, Anto Antony

media:content.media:description: Sam Altman, chief executive officer of OpenAI, right, and Masayoshi Son, chairman and chief executive officer of SoftBank Group Corp., during the Transforming Business through AI Conference in Tokyo, Japan, on Monday, Feb. 3, 2025. SoftBank Group and OpenAI will create a joint venture to develop and sell AI services to businesses across Japan, establishing one of the broadest efforts yet to sell the fast-growing startup’s tools to enterprise customers outside of the US.

item.title: Saudi Arabia Launches New AI Firm Ahead of Trump’s Visit
item.description: Saudi Arabia has launched a new firm to invest across the artificial intelligence value chain, ahead of a visit by US President Donald Trump, where the technology is expected to feature prominently on the agenda.
item.dc:creator: Omar El Chmouri

media:content.media:description: The King Abdullah Financial Center in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.

item.title: The iPhone Is a Nicer Place With Fewer Restrictions After Ruling
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Austin Carr looks at the impact of the latest ruling ordering Apple to reform its App Store practices.
item.dc:creator: Austin Carr

media:content.media:description: The Apple App Store app on a smartphone arranged in New York, US, on Monday, Aug. 14, 2023. The US Supreme Court let Apple Inc. keep its App Store payment rules in place for the time being, rejecting an Epic Games Inc. request that would have let developers start directing iPhone users to other purchasing options.

item.title: Laurence Tosi’s WestCap Backs Digital Infrastructure Startup
item.description: A private markets veteran is betting there’s money to be made by bringing better technology to his industry.
item.dc:creator: Preeti Singh

media:content.media:description: Laurence Tosi Source: WestCap Group

item.title: Air-Taxi Startup Vertical Goes Hybrid in Pivot Toward Defense
item.description: Vertical Aerospace Ltd is building a hybrid variant of its battery-powered air taxi, in a bet that a longer-range aircraft will attract investment from the lucrative defense sector.
item.dc:creator: Kate Duffy

media:content.media:description: Vertical Aerospace’s VX-4 prototype aircraft.

item.title: Mazda Withholds Profit Guidance as Suzuki Dodges Trump’s Tariffs
item.description: Mazda Motor Co. withheld its annual profit guidance after its short-term future, along with most global carmakers, was muddied by US President Donald Trump’s trade war.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Takahashi

media:content.media:description: The Mazda logo.

item.title: Xiaomi Shares Drop as Consumers Complain About Marketing of EVs
item.description: Xiaomi Corp. shares dropped as much as 5.7% in Hong Kong on Monday after a local media report over the weekend that said more than 300 people want to cancel their SU7 Ultra electric vehicle orders on “false advertising” about the design of the vehicle’s hood.
item.dc:creator: Linda Lew, Kelly Li

media:content.media:description: A Xiaomi Corp. SU7 Ultra electric vehicle.

item.title: VC Firm Backed by Golub Family Office Starts Mideast-US AI Fund
item.description: A Saudi Arabia-based venture capital firm that’s backed by the family office of US billionaire Lawrence Golub is launching a $50 million fund to invest in artificial intelligence startups across the Middle East and the San Francisco Bay Area.
item.dc:creator: Christine Burke

item.title: AI Drug Firm METiS Considering $200 Million Hong Kong IPO, Sources Say
item.description: Artificial intelligence-driven drug firm METiS Pharmaceuticals is considering an initial public offering in Hong Kong to raise as much as $200 million, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Julia Fioretti, Amber Tong

item.title: Amazon-Backed Scale AI Plans Middle East Expansion With New Saudi Arabia Office
item.description: Scale AI, a startup backed by Amazon.com Inc. that helps companies develop artificial intelligence products, plans to open an office in Saudi Arabia by the end of the year in a broader regional expansion.
item.dc:creator: Omar El Chmouri

item.title: Activist Dalton Seeks Talks With Fuji Media to Avoid Proxy Fight
item.description: Dalton Investments’ co-founder James Rosenwald said he wants to avoid a proxy fight with Fuji Media Holdings Inc., calling on the Japanese broadcaster to negotiate a settlement.
item.dc:creator: Min Jeong Lee

media:content.media:description: The flight of big-name advertisers spurred Fuji Media to slash its annual outlook and overhaul its board.
